title: How to Make Baby Hair Bows with No Slip Grip Material

steps.headline: Buy your favorite ribbon (3/8 inch ribbon works really well).
steps.description: Pick out ribbon that match some of her/your favorite outfits or ribbon in girly colors, patterns and designs. You will need approximately three pieces of ribbon that are about four inches long per bow so keep that in mind when purchasing ribbon.

steps.headline: Pick up double prong hair clips that are approximately 1 ¾ inches long.
steps.description: This will become your bow base so consider using plastic coated metal clips to protect baby’s delicate scalp.

steps.headline: Buy rubber shelf liner and white felt.
steps.description: You’ll end up cutting small pieces of both felt and shelf liner to hold the bow in place on your child’s bald (or sparsely covered hair) head.

steps.headline: Obtain a lighter or match to seal the ends of the ribbon.
steps.description: Also heat up your hot glue gun to put it all together.

steps.headline: Cut supplies to create bow.
steps.description: Have everything cut and ready before putting the bow together.

steps.headline: Cut one long piece of ribbon.
Hot glue approximately ½ inch of the ribbon to the bottom area of the clip.
steps.description: Most of the ribbon will still be hanging off the clip.

steps.headline: Add a small glob of glue to the next part of the ribbon and then fold it back around the edges of the clip (you are basically going to wrap the clip with the ribbon, leaving the bottom part of the clip still exposed).
Place the next piece of ribbon down the inside of the top portion of the clip and secure with hot glue.
steps.description: The top part of the clip and side should now be completely covered with ribbon.

steps.headline: Create the bow by tying one of the four inch strips in a knot.
Glue the pre-cut piece of shelf liner and felt together.
steps.description: Press layers together and wait until fully cooled before using your fingers to press together. Scrap any glue that escapes from the sides of the pieces. Trim edges if necessary.

steps.headline: Glue the shelf liner/felt piece along the inside of the top portion of the clip.
steps.description: This is the element that will hold the bow in place.

steps.headline: Add bow to the top of the ribbon with several dabs of hot glue.
steps.description: Hold in place until completely dry/cool.

text:
Purchase Supplies Buy your favorite ribbon (3/8 inch ribbon works really well). Pick out ribbon that match some of her/your favorite outfits or ribbon in girly colors, patterns and designs. You will need approximately three pieces of ribbon that are about four inches long per bow so keep that in mind when purchasing ribbon. Pick up double prong hair clips that are approximately 1 ¾ inches long. This will become your bow base so consider using plastic coated metal clips to protect baby’s delicate scalp. Buy rubber shelf liner and white felt. You’ll end up cutting small pieces of both felt and shelf liner to hold the bow in place on your child’s bald (or sparsely covered hair) head. Obtain a lighter or match to seal the ends of the ribbon. Also heat up your hot glue gun to put it all together. Create Bows Cut supplies to create bow. Have everything cut and ready before putting the bow together. Cut one long piece of ribbon. You will be using this piece to wrap nearly the entire clip with ribbon before adding your bow. Seal ribbon ends with a little heat (match or lighter). Cut three pieces of ribbon, four inches long. Seal ribbon ends with a little heat (match or lighter). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/71/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut the felt and rubber shelf liner the same size-- 1 ¼ by 1/3 of an inch. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Hot glue approximately ½ inch of the ribbon to the bottom area of the clip. Most of the ribbon will still be hanging off the clip. Add a small glob of glue to the next part of the ribbon and then fold it back around the edges of the clip (you are basically going to wrap the clip with the ribbon, leaving the bottom part of the clip still exposed). Place the next piece of ribbon down the inside of the top portion of the clip and secure with hot glue. The top part of the clip and side should now be completely covered with ribbon. Create the bow by tying one of the four inch strips in a knot. Be sure the knot is in the middle of the strip and can lay flat. Create a circle shape with each remaining ribbon. Make a loop and add a small dab of glue to the ends. Hold in place until dry and flatten. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/4/44/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pinch the circle right in the center and add a dot of hot glue to the inside center. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make an “X” with the two circle pieces of ribbon and glue together in the middle of the ribbon “X.”{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Lay the ribbon with the knot in the middle across the top of the ribbon “X.” Wrap the knot piece ends around the “X” and secure with hot glue. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet4.jpg/aid2977413-v4-728px-Make-Baby-Hair-Bows-with-No-Slip-Grip-Material-Step-10Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Glue the pre-cut piece of shelf liner and felt together. Press layers together and wait until fully cooled before using your fingers to press together. Scrap any glue that escapes from the sides of the pieces. Trim edges if necessary. Glue the shelf liner/felt piece along the inside of the top portion of the clip. This is the element that will hold the bow in place. Add bow to the top of the ribbon with several dabs of hot glue. Hold in place until completely dry/cool. Finished.
